name: Grandmaster of the Astral Wind (Monk 35 / Shadowdancer 5)
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
First, all credit must be given to Webshaman for this idea, and for making me embrace my inner monk.  It’s essentially the Deadly Nightshade build, except I removed the UMD training wheels, and made some optimizations to increase combat prowess and playability in pre-epic.  While he is not spell-proof like the Nightshade, he is darn near it.  I’ve also made some changes on SD acquisition so that Uncanny Dodge is obtained right away to help with flat-footed issues in pre-epic (as well as HiPS). I also removed the Evil alignment restriction the Nightshade demands.  AB is also significantly higher.  And now to introduce….

Weaknesses
  • Low Fort Save (watch out for Dev Crit!) Against casters you’ll have little to worry about.
  • No UMD (in order to bend the spoon, one must first throw away the spoon)
 
Other Builds Using the Same Combo
  • Shadowfist -- SC V build with a crappy AB
  • Furry Feet of Fury Halfling AC monkey by Tattoed Monk. Not bad actually.
 
Builder’s Commentary
Silver, sleek, diamond-shrouded, and rocking 6 fists per round whose base damage is greater than that of greatswords, there’s a lot to unpack in this one.  What I liked about WebShaman’s Nightshade was pure spell immunity.  But I felt it was slightly out of balance in certain melee situations and had to rely on UMD or specific gloves or items.  The Astral Wind attempts to thread the needle to find that balance, which is true for most monks in an esoteric sense. The final SR here is 55, and as I broke down above, Level 35 casters and below are powerless (save for Epic Spells which blow throw any monk), and even Level 40 casters have only a 20% chance of succeeding. This is usually more than enough, or at least long enough for one to launch IKD, Stunning Fist, Quivering Palm to drop the frail mage in his tracks.  His high AC, combined with Epic Dodge and Empty Body, makes him virtually unhittable in combat, though one should still take Dev Crit into account and do what you can to boost Fort Saves.  And when all else fails, you still have HiPS and cheetah-speed to escape.
 
He maintains 110% increase to speed, immune to mind effects, poisons, diseases, and even sports a Damage Reduction that makes him immune to Manticore Spikes and Evards Black Tentacles of Intrusion (which, btw, is one of the few spells that bypass SR).
 
His bare knuckles come with a natural 40 AB (halfling variant gets 41), and he has 35 Stunning Fists in his arsenal for those rainy days when you want some strange.  But I thought 40 AB was the bare minimum needed to be at least playable in multiple environment-types and milieus.  
 
Like most Unarmed Monks, you are, in a sense, limited by the quality of gloves available and this will vary with the module and its designer.  Yet even HotU has some excellent gloves available.  Some worlds, like WoG for instance, even have the option for one to custom craft their own gloves from scratch.
 
And then one might ask, “Damn GDL, no UMD? What the H-E- Double Hockeysticks?” My response is only this – the true aesthetic needs no UMD.  Take off the training wheels and play your monks old school.  It presents a new challenge, new problem solving, and is really quite refreshing in a sense.
 
“Is this better than the Nightshade?” No, it’s just different.  It’s better in some regards while the Nightshade is better in others.  Where the Nightshade gets slightly better SR and UMD acquisition, the Astral Wind gets better AB and slightly better AC, higher HP, and much earlier Uncanny Dodge/HiPS acquisition.
 
Built and play-tested on the World of Greyhawk Action Server.  Slightly shaken but not stirred.
 
Cheers lads!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I love it!

I won't give up my Nightshade, but it is cool to see other variants of the it being built.

Regarding the Dev Crit susceptibility, if the AC is high enough, it becomes moot, and this build does get a substantial AC (and one should not forget Epic Dodge avoiding the first hit, irrespectively).  As such, I think the threat of being Dev Critted is somewhat mitigated by the build itself.

I think the main difference between this and my Nightshade is that I found a way to "squeeze in" UMD and Death Attack, at little loss (UMD helps make up for the loss in AB to this build, significantly).  Still, for the more Monk Purest, or for those who do not wish to have an evil alignment, this build does offer an alternative (and in an environment where UMD may be nerfed, this build will probably still be viable).

Note that if I am seeing this correctly, by taking SD levels pre-Epic here, one looses 1 AB.  The Epic Prowess makes up for that, so the EWF gives a +2.

So this build gets a +2 better AB than Nightshade.  I think that in most cases, UMD will more than make up for that.  I don't really see an increase in damage here - both rely on Fists. 

Please note that any small Race (such as Halfling and Gnome) will suffer damage reduction to Fist damage (2D6 vs 1D20) for being small.  This may not be a problem in some environments, but in others, it will be (where bludgeoning DR is present).

Thanks for the build, GDL.

Agreed.  However, my real goal for the early SD was not to get HiPS, but to get Uncanny Dodge as soon as possible.  Monks have a way of finding themselves flatfooted more than they should (cleave, etc), and one needs to safeguard that Dex AC as much as possible.  Verily, I would scrap SD altogether if Monk could acquire Defensive Roll as a bonus feat (why can't Defensive Roll be a bonus feat?  Truly, they're monks for Moardin's sake -- they're shao-lin,kung-fu, weng chun, tumbling, Monkey-style, Mantis-style, wind-in-the-grass style, planewalking, mage-eating, corvette-racing diamond souls, and they can't learn a defensive roll? Bah!)

Still, there is a certain sense of quasi-immortality with Monks who go deep in level with Improved SR feats, very high AC supported by Epic Dodge, Deflect Arrow, Empty Body, Improved Evasion, HiPS and DM-like speed.  It's like a gamer's intoxication, in a way.

posts.author: webshaman1

Man, I agree with all you posted!

I have no idea why Defensive Roll is not a Monk feat as well.  The mind boggles.  IMO, Monks should have "fighting styles" that change their feat access, damage type, etc.  And one should be able to learn more than one, and be able to switch between them...that would be "teh Chizz".

Anyway, yeah, Monk mixed in with SD really does have a mighty toolkit - combined with Elf Keen Senses, and it becomes one the best explorers of any Server.  I just like the added level of Ass (because Rogue takes too much away from Monk levels) for the UMD, etc.  Oh, and the Death Attack.  Extra D6 damage (especially when KDing) and a chance to paralyze.  Goes really well with the HiPSing.

Though in your build, the breakdown of levels is more optimal - that 1 level of Monk is a feat AND +1 AC.
